Type.Name: Rectangle
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: A rectangle is defined by its , , and upper-left corner represented by the property.

To draw rectangles, you need a object and a object. The object provides the method, and the object stores features of the line, such as color and width. The units the rectangle is drawn in is determined by the and properties of the graphics object used for drawing. The default unit is pixels.
To draw a filled with color, you need a object and an object derived from such as or . The object provides the method and the object provides the color and fill information.
For more advanced shapes, use a object.

summary.para: Stores a set of four integers that represent the location and size of a rectangle
Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified location and size.

Docs.param: A that represents the upper-left corner of the rectangular region.
A that represents the width and height of the rectangular region.

MemberSignature.Value: public Rectangle (int x, int y, int width, int height);

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified location and size.

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'int'

remarks.para: The value of the property represents the y-coordinate of the first point at the bottom edge of the that is not contained in the .

summary.para: Gets the y-coordinate that is the sum of the and property values of this structure.
Converts the specified structure to a structure by rounding the values to the next higher integer values.

Docs.param: The structure to be converted.

remarks.para: The containing rectangle must be normalized for this method to return accurate results.

summary.para: Determines if the specified point is contained within this structure.

returns.para: This method returns true if the point represented by is contained within this structure; otherwise false.

Docs.param: The to test.

remarks.para: The containing rectangle must be normalized for this method to return accurate results.

summary.para: Determines if the rectangular region represented by is entirely contained within this structure.

returns.para: This method returns true if the rectangular region represented by is entirely contained within this structure; otherwise false.

Docs.param: The to test.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Contains (int x, int y);

remarks.para: The containing rectangle must be normalized for this method to return accurate results.

summary.para: Determines if the specified point is contained within this structure.

returns.para: This method returns true if the point defined by and is contained within this structure; otherwise false.

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the point to test.
The y-coordinate of the point to test.

remarks.para: A rectangle is defined by its width, height and upper-left corner.

summary.para: Represents a structure with its properties left uninitialized.
Tests whether is a structure with the same location and size of this structure.

returns.para: This method returns true if is a structure and its , , , and properties are equal to the corresponding properties of this structure; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The to test.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Drawing.Rectangle FromLTRB (int left, int top, int right, int bottom);

remarks.para: This method creates a with the specified upper-left and lower-right corners.

summary.para: Creates a structure with the specified edge locations.

returns.para: The new that this method creates.

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this structure.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this structure.
The x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of this structure.
The y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of this structure.

summary.para: Returns the hash code for this structure. For information about the use of hash codes, see .

returns.para: An integer that represents the hash code for this rectangle.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'int'

remarks.para: Changing the property will also cause a change in the property of the . The units the rectangle is drawn in is determined by the and properties of the graphics object used for drawing. The default unit is pixels.

summary.para: Gets or sets the height of this structure.

remarks.para: This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it. The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis. For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is enlarged by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.

summary.para: Enlarges this by the specified amount.

Docs.param: The amount to inflate this rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Inflate (int width, int height);

remarks.para: This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it. The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis. For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is enlarged by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
If either or is negative, the structure is deflated in the corresponding direction.

summary.para: Enlarges this by the specified amount.

Docs.param: The amount to inflate this horizontally.
The amount to inflate this vertically.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Drawing.Rectangle Inflate (System.Drawing.Rectangle rect, int x, int y);

remarks.para: This method makes a copy of , enlarges the copy, and then returns the enlarged copy. The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis. For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is enlarged by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.

summary.para: Creates and returns an enlarged copy of the specified structure. The copy is enlarged by the specified amount. The original structure remains unmodified.

Docs.param: The with which to start. This rectangle is not modified.
The amount to inflate this horizontally.
The amount to inflate this vertically.

summary.para: Replaces this with the intersection of itself and the specified .

Docs.param: The with which to intersect.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Drawing.Rectangle Intersect (System.Drawing.Rectangle a, System.Drawing.Rectangle b);

summary.para: Returns a third structure that represents the intersection of two other structures. If there is no intersection, an empty is returned.

returns.para: A that represents the intersection of and .

Docs.param: A rectangle to intersect.
A rectangle to intersect.

summary.para: Determines if this rectangle intersects with .

returns.para: This method returns true if there is any intersection, otherwise false.

Docs.param: The rectangle to test.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'bool'

summary.para: Tests whether all numeric properties of this have values of zero.

summary.para: Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of this structure.

remarks.para: This method adjusts the location of the upper-left corner horizontally by the x-coordinate of the specified point, and vertically by the y-coordinate of the specified point.

summary.para: Adjusts the location of this rectangle by the specified amount.

Docs.param: Amount to offset the location.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Offset (int x, int y);

summary.para: Adjusts the location of this rectangle by the specified amount.

Docs.param: The horizontal offset.
The vertical offset.

summary.para: Tests whether two structures have equal location and size.

returns.para: This operator returns true if the two structures have equal , , , and properties.

Docs.param: The structure that is to the left of the equality operator.
The structure that is to the right of the equality operator.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Inequality (System.Drawing.Rectangle left, System.Drawing.Rectangle right);

summary.para: Tests whether two structures differ in location or size.

returns.para: This operator returns true if any of the , , or properties of the two structures are unequal; otherwise false.

summary.para: Gets the y-coordinate of the top edge of this structure.
Converts the attributes of this to a human-readable string.

returns.para: A string that contains the position, width, and height of this structure Â¾ for example, {X=20, Y=20, Width=100, Height=50}

summary.para: Converts the specified to a by truncating the values.

Docs.param: The to be converted.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Drawing.Rectangle Union (System.Drawing.Rectangle a, System.Drawing.Rectangle b);

remarks.para: When one of the two rectangles is empty, meaning all of its values are zero, the method returns a rectangle with a starting point of (0, 0), and the height and width of the non-empty rectangle. For example, if you have two rectangles: A = (0, 0; 0, 0) and B = (1, 1; 2, 2), then the union of A and B is (0, 0; 2, 2).

summary.para: Gets a structure that contains the union of two structures.

returns.para: A structure that bounds the union of the two structures.

Docs.param: A rectangle to union.
A rectangle to union.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'int'
